flashcards.front: the Hulk was originally grey, but became green to compensate for poor color separation in print.
Stan Lee put a hyphen in Spider-Manâ€™s name so it would look different from Superman in print.
G.I. Joe was originally intended as a new direction for Nick Fury and S.H.I.E.L.D.
Marvel Comics owned the rights to the word zombie from 1975 through 1996, until they realized it was impossible to enforce the trademark.
